metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5604 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An incorrect implementation of "XEP-0280: Message Carbons" in multiple XMPP clients allows a remote attacker to impersonate any user, including contacts, in the vulnerable application's display. This allows for various kinds of social engineering attacks. This CVE is for mcabber 1.0.0 - 1.0.4.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5604` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mcabber - 1.1.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mcabber package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.0-1').
